alert.note: Alert for Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 24 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A KNOZONE ACTION DAY HAS BEEN DECLARED... The officials at the Office of Sustainability for the City of Indianapolis have called for a Knozone Action Day on Saturday, June 25th for the following Indiana counties... Marion This Knozone Action Day will be in effect from 1200 AM to 1159 PM. A Knozone Action Day means that a combination of the high temperatures, light winds, and other factors, are expected to produce conditions where high levels of ozone emissions may exceed federally mandated standards. Here are some recommended actions that the public can take to reduce ozone forming emissions: * Walk, bike, carpool or use public transportation. * Avoid using the drive-through and combine errands into one trip. * Avoid refueling your vehicle or using gasoline-powered lawn equipment until after 7pm. * Turn off your engine when idling for more than 30 seconds. * Conserve energy by turning off lights or setting the air conditioner to 75 degrees or above.
